title: JumpCloud Single Sign-On (Preview)
descriptionMarkdown: The [JumpCloud](https://www.JumpCloud.com) connector provides the capability to ingest audit and event logs from the JumpCloud API into Azure Sentinel. The connector provides visibility into these log types in Azure Sentinel to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and to improve monitoring and investigation capabilities.

sampleQueries.query:
JumpCloud_CL 
| mv-expand todynamic(target_s)  
| where target_s.type == "AppInstance"  
| summarize count() by tostring(target_s.alternateId)  
| top 10 by count_

JumpCloud_CL 
| summarize count() by client_ip_s 
| top 10 by count_

value:
JumpCloud_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(5d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

customs.name: JumpCloud API Token

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to JumpCloud to pull its logs into Azure Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

**STEP 1 - Configuration steps for the JumpCloud API**

 [Follow these instructions](https://jumpcloud-insights.api-docs.io/1.0/authentication-and-authorization) to create an API Token.

**STEP 2 - Choose ONE from the following two deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure Function**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the JumpCloud connector, have the Workspace ID and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the JumpCloud SSO API Authorization Token, readily available.

instructionSteps.title: Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template
instructionSteps.description:
This method provides an automated deployment of the JumpCloud SSO connector using an ARM Tempate.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinelJumpCloudazuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the **Workspace ID**, **Workspace Key**, **API Token**, **URI** and **TimeInterval**. 
 - The default **Time Interval** is set to pull the last five (5) minutes of data. If the time interval needs to be modified, it is recommended to change the Function App Timer Trigger accordingly (in the function.json file, post deployment) to prevent overlapping data ingestion.
 - Use the following schema for the `uri` value: `https://api.jumpcloud.com/insights/directory/v1/events`. 
 - Note: If using Azure Key Vault secrets for any of the values above, use the`@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri={Security Identifier})`schema in place of the string values. Refer to [Key Vault references documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) for further details. 
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.

instructionSteps.title: Option 2 - Manual Deployment of Azure Functions
instructionSteps.description: Use the following step-by-step instructions to deploy the JumpCloud SSO connector manually with Azure Functions.

**1. Create a Function App**

1.  From the Azure Portal, navigate to [Function App](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/Microsoft.Web%2Fsites/kind/functionapp), and select **+ Add**.
2. In the **Basics** tab, ensure Runtime stack is set to **Powershell Core**. 
3. In the **Hosting** tab, ensure the **Consumption (Serverless)** plan type is selected.
4. Make other preferrable configuration changes, if needed, then click **Create**.

**2. Import Function App Code**

1. In the newly created Function App, select **Functions** on the left pane and click **+ Add**.
2. Select **Timer Trigger**.
3. Enter a unique Function **Name** and leave the default cron schedule of every 5 minutes, then click **Create**.
4. Click on **Code + Test** on the left pane. 
5. Copy the [Function App Code](https://aka.ms/sentinelJumpCloudazurefunctioncode) and paste into the Function App `run.ps1` editor.
5. Click **Save**.

**3. Configure the Function App**

1. In the Function App, select the Function App Name and select **Configuration**.
2. In the **Application settings** tab, select **+ New application setting**.
3. Add each of the following eight (8) application settings individually, with their respective string values (case-sensitive): 
		AzureSentinelTable
		JumpCloudapiToken
		JumpCloudEventTypes
		JumpCloudStartTime
		JumpCloudUri
		timeInterval
		workspaceID
		workspaceKey
- For AzureSentinelTable must be JumpCloud for supplied queries, workbooks etc to work without editing
- For JumpCoud Event Types insert one or more of the following seperated by ';' directory radius sso systems ldap mdm
- For JumpCloudStartTime enter a date within the last 15 days as per JumpCloud history limits, must be in the format '2020-07-24T00:00:00Z' which is UTC time 
- Set the `timeInterval` (in minutes) to the default value of `5` to correspond to the default Timer Trigger of every `5` minutes. Note that modifying time interval will require modifying the Function App Timer Trigger accordingly to prevent overlapping data.
 - Use the following schema for the `uri` value: `https://api.jumpcloud.com/insights/directory/v1/events` 
 - Note: If using Azure Key Vault secrets for any of the values above, use the`@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri={Security Identifier})`schema in place of the string values. Refer to [Key Vault references documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) for further details. 
4. Once all application settings have been entered, click **Save**.
